decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Drawing no. 2023 OS 100042766 (Existing Site Location Plan)
Drawing no. 200 (Proposed Location Plan of 18 Montana Road) Dated 12/06/2023.
Drawing no. 201(Proposed Site Plan of 18 Montana Road) Dated 12/ 06/2023 
Drawing no. 210(Proposed Ground Floor Plan) Dated 12/06/2023. 
Drawing no. 211 (Proposed First Floor Plan) Dated 12/06/2023. 
Drawing no. 220 (Proposed Section AA Plan ) Dated 12/06/2023 
Drawing no. 221(Proposed Section BB Plan) Dated 12/06/2023,
Drawing no. 222 (Proposed Section CC Plan)Dated 12/06/2023.
Drawing no. 223 (Proposed Section DD Plan) Dated 12/06/2023 
Drawing no. 230 (Proposed Rear Elevation Plan) Dated 12/06/2023
Drawing no.231 (Proposed East Elevation Plan)Dated 12/06/2023 
Drawing no 232( Proposed West Elevation Plan) Dated 12/06/2023
Drawing no   250 (3D View of rear extension 2)Dated 12/06/2023
Drawing no. 251 (3D Visualisation 1) Dated 12/06/2023
Drawing no. 252 (3D Visualisation 2)Dated 12/06/2023

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - Construction Times - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

  i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
description: APPLICATION FOR ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSIONS TO MAIN BUILDING, AND CONVERSION OF THE SIDE ADJOINING GARAGE INTO HABITABLE ROOMS
